location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter from Francis Warden, Chief Secretary to the Government, Political Department, Bombay to Lieutenant William Bruce, Resident at Bushire

mods.abstract: The letter is enclosing a copy of a communication received by Francis Warden from Henry Meriton, Superintendent of the Marine, dated 22 March 1815. The enclosed communication contains instructions to be passed on to Captain Hamilton, Commander of the HC Cruizer Aurora. The instructions order the Captain to provide passage for Mirza Sorab Beg [M카rz훮 Suhr훮b Beg] to Bushire, before delivering packets to Bussora [Basra]; any packets for Bombay from Bussora should be delivered on the return trip. It further warns that reports have been received of Joasmee [Qaw훮sim] pirates being present in 'great force' in the Gulf.
